aoop.asteroids.model.gameobjects

Class GameObject

  • java.lang.Object
    • aoop.asteroids.model.gameobjects.GameObject
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    Asteroid, Bullet, Explosion, Spaceship

    public abstract class GameObject
extends java.lang.Object
    GameObject is the abstract superclass for all spatial game objects. I.e. bullets, asteroids and spaceships. This class provides some of the basic mechanics, such as movement and collision detection, and the destruction mechanism.

      This function returns a Collection of possibly multiple locations at which a graphical representation of this GameObject should be drawn.
      By drawing each of these, we ensure that objects that are half across the screen edge will draw their other half at the other side of the screen.

    • Method Detail

      • nextStep

        public void nextStep()
        This function determines how this GameObject moves from one frame to the next. Subclasses might want to specify their own behaviour.

      • destroy

        public void destroy()
        Marks the object for destruction by setting the destroyed value to true. Destruction happens in the Game class that has a reference to this GameObject, by removing this reference. Afterwards it can be safely garbage collected.

      • getRadius

        public int getRadius()
        Returns the radius of the object.
        Returns:
        radius of the object in amount of pixels.

      • getLocation

        public java.awt.geom.Point2D getLocation()
        Returns:
        the location of the object.

      • getWrappedLocation

        public java.awt.geom.Point2D getWrappedLocation(double width,
                                       double height)
        Returns:
        The location of the object, modulo the given `width` (for the x-position) and `height` (for the y-position)

      • setLocation

        public void setLocation(java.awt.geom.Point2D location)
        Parameters:
        location - The new two-dimensional location the GameObject should be at.

      • getVelocityX

        public double getVelocityX()
        Returns:
        the velocity in X direction.

      • getVelocityY

        public double getVelocityY()
        Returns:
        the velocity in Y direction.

      • isDestroyed

        public boolean isDestroyed()
        Returns:
        true if the object is marked for destruction, false otherwise.

      • getSuccessors

        public java.util.List<? extends GameObject> getSuccessors()
        The default implementation of getSuccessors is to return an empty list. Note that specifically Asteroid overrides this functionality.
        Returns:
        an empty list.
        See Also:
        Asteroid.getSuccessors()

      • clone

        public abstract GameObject clone()
        Clones the GameObject.
        Overrides:
        clone in class java.lang.Object

      • collidesThroughEdge

        public boolean collidesThroughEdge(GameObject other,
                          double width,
                          double height)
        An improved version of the collision detection that will also detect collisions through world-wrap edges
        Parameters:
        other - The GameObject to check collision against.
        width - The width at which the world wraps horizontally
        height - The height at which the world wraps vertically

      • toJSON

        public org.json.simple.JSONArray toJSON()
        Returns:
        a JSONArray containing the important spatial information of this GameObject (x,y, velocityX, velocityY).

      • getMirrorLocations

        public java.util.Collection<java.awt.geom.Point2D> getMirrorLocations(double width,
                                                             double height)
        This function returns a Collection of possibly multiple locations at which a graphical representation of this GameObject should be drawn.
        By drawing each of these, we ensure that objects that are half across the screen edge will draw their other half at the other side of the screen.
        Parameters:
        width - The width at which the world wraps horizontally
        height - The height at which the world wraps vertically
        Returns:
        A list of one or more locations at which the object might appear

      • getMirrorLocations

        public java.util.Collection<java.awt.geom.Point2D> getMirrorLocations(double width,
                                                             double height,
                                                             double radius)
        This function returns a Collection of possibly multiple locations at which a graphical representation of this GameObject should be drawn.
        By drawing each of these, we ensure that objects that are half across the screen edge will draw their other half at the other side of the screen.
        In this case, a radius other than the radius defined inside the GameObject itself is used.
        Parameters:
        width - The width at which the world wraps horizontally
        height - The height at which the world wraps vertically
        radius - The radius to use.
        Returns:
        A list of one or more locations at which the object might appear
